x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: Reduces duplicate reporting; routes cases automatically; provides a single source of truth for all municipal faults.Lowers the cost of infrastructure maintenance by allowing proactive repair and optimizing field service technician routes Increases citizen satisfaction through easy mobile reporting and transparency via public status tracking.Improves public safety (e.g., fixing broken traffic signals faster) and fosters a more collaborative relationship between the community and local government.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Municipal governments often rely on outdated systems, phone calls, or emails to receive reports about public infrastructure faults (e.g., potholes, broken streetlights, illegal dumping, damaged signs). This leads to slow response times, duplicated effort, and poor data quality, ultimately reducing the quality of life in the community.
